intro: Polyphlebium venosum, commonly known as the veiny moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit and intricate network of leaf veins, which give it its common name. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on soil or rock surfaces in temperate regions. Its small, elliptical leaves are usually arranged in two rows, contributing to its compact appearance. Polyphlebium venosum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
